oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood to his wife Cordelia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood, Co. D, 43rd Wisc. Infantry Regiment, USA writes to his wife Cordelia. He describes having mittens and going on picket duty. As he eats his breakfast his seat is a 12 foot board with one man lying on his back smoking while another man is "greasing his boots out of the frying pan." He provides details on how the pickets were placed and the rotation of relief pickets every two hours. When in camp he describes brushing his uniform, buttons and brass on his equipments.
